com.nv.util
Class AppUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.nv.util.AppUtil

public class AppUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class that provides common functionality for resource allocation/deallocation and general management regarding the entire application.

Author:
rterrell

Method Detail

getAppProperty

public static final java.lang.String getAppProperty(java.lang.String propName)
Queries the internal application properties collection for a value based on the propName.

Parameters:
propName - The key used to obtain the property value.
Returns:
the value of propName or null if property name does not exists.

addAppProperty

public static final java.lang.String addAppProperty(java.lang.String propName,
                                                    java.lang.String value)
Adds a property to the collection of application properties.

Parameters:
propName - The key name of the property
value - The value of the property
Returns:
value when added successfully or null when the Properties collection has not been initialized.

showMessage

public static final void showMessage(javax.swing.JLabel comp,
                                     java.lang.String message,
                                     boolean error)
Uses the specified component, comp, to display a message anchored by its parent to the user.

The HTML paragraph tag, <P$gt;, is used to enclose the message text so that the JLabel component is forced to wrap excessively long message text.

Parameters:
comp - an instance of JLabel that is used to display a message on its parent.
message - The message to be displayed.
error - When true, the font color of the message is RED. Otherwise, the font color is BLACK.

initLogger

public void initLogger()
                throws AppInitException
Sets up the logging environment that is to be used throughout the entire application.

Throws:
AppInitException - if the log4j.properties is not found or the occurrence of genreal IO errors

initStoreList

public void initStoreList()
                   throws AppInitException
Retrieves the site's store list.

The source of this information is required to exist in the configuration file, sotreList.properties, which is located in the /config directory. This listing can contain one to many entries which each entry is of the format, ",".

Throws:
AppInitException

initSiteConfig

public void initSiteConfig(java.lang.String serverName)
                    throws AppInitException
Loads the property file that contains configuration information about the application as it pertains to a particular site.

This process replicates the common configuration, application.proerties, into the site specifice configuration, site.properties. Site configuration will contain both common and specific information pertaining to the current site. An example of specific information is the selected server name.

Parameters:
serverName - The name of the server where the database resides
Throws:
AppInitException - Unable to identify the server name or error persisting the site.properties file.

getStoreList

public java.util.List<StoreListItem> getStoreList()
Returns:
the storeList

public static javax.swing.ImageIcon getAppIcon()
Obtains a icon image for the application.

Returns:
ImageIcon
